p: Phylogenetic analysis is a useful tool that can be reliably used to define clusters of closely related sequences reflecting actual transmission, [ 12] while traditional epidemiological approaches based on behavioral information cannot. When combined with epidemiological and clinical data, more detailed transmission information can be identified that could be of public health relevance [ 13â€“ 15]. This method had been successfully used to implement tailored preventive interventions for different high-risk population subgroups, such as commercial sex workers, [ 16] men who have sex with men (MSM), [ 17] and injecting drug users (IDUs) [ 18].
